intro: Tetracera tomentosa, commonly known as the hairy tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by specialized bracts. It typically grows as an understory shrub in tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
